title: Free call-blockers to be offered to scam victims
text:
Free call-blockers will be made available to some people targeted by scammers.

Up to 2,000 devices are being provided on a first come, first served basis by the National Trading Standards Scams Team.

It follows a pilot programme in 2017 in which 99 per cent of scam and nuisance phone calls were blocked.

Up to 2,000 call-blockers are being provided on a first come, first served basis by the National Trading Standards Scams Team

Before the trial, 31 per cent of users had lost a total of £970,042 to cold-callers. After the pilot, only 1 per cent of users had lost money to the calls.

The devices block all recorded messages, silent calls and numbers not identified by the homeowner, and offer particular protection to those with dementia.

Local authorities and care providers are expected to apply on behalf of victims.

Individual applications from victims or family members will also be available.

Lord Toby Harris, of National Trading Standards, says: 'It's really important that the Government is extending this programme to help even more victims.'
